event.title: acquired the island for Britain in 1846

data.event: James Brooke acquired the island for Britain in 1846 through a treaty with the Sultan of Brunei, Omar Ali Saifuddin II on 18 December 1846.

event.title: took Pengiran Mumin to witness the island's accession to the British Crown on 24 December 1846

data.event: A British naval officer, Rodney Mundy, visited Brunei with his ship HMS Iris to keep the Sultan in line until the British Government made a final decision to take the island and he took Pengiran Mumin to witness the island's accession to the British Crown on 24 December 1846.
